The 5-minute "French Roast Coffee" left me a little disoriented at the end, but it was probably just from the experience of hearing white noise and high-frequency tones for five minutes.

The 30-minute "Cocaine" did nothing for me.  It was aurally the same thing.  It had no effect.  It's kind of like listening to ambient electronic noise music!

Placebo effect, I'd say.  If white noise and modulating frequency tones are enough to pleasurably disorient you, then more power to you.  But personally, I think it's psuedoscience.

If you actually went to the Idoser site, it says that this program DOES NOT work for everyone. That there are three different types of people.
1. People susceptible to bi-neural beats.
2. People originally insusceptible to the beats.
3. People immune to the beats.

Idoser doesn't work for everyone. Just because it doesn't work for YOU, does NOT mean that nobody else should give it a try.

Hugs and kisses.

I realize they say these don't work for everyone, but anyone who has tried real LSD will tell you there's no way in hell a sound could replicate that feeling, especially these sounds. White noise + WHOOOOOW does not make an acid trip. If you tell people you've done LSD/Crack/Nitrous and it wasn't a big deal because you listened to these, prepare to be laughed out of the conversation by any serious druggies. Half the experience is *what you see when you open your eyes*, and with this your eyes have to remain closed.

I listened to the "gates of hades" track and prepared myself for a mindfuck, instead I thought about bunnies, a jet, the cast of the Simpsons... and at the end I was very calm and sleepy. Not exactly the "hell in an mp3" people describe it as.

Just my 2 cents.
